informal_proof:
For every $k$ such that $2 \leq k \leq 10000$, $\frac{1}{\sqrt{k}} < \int_{k-1}^{k} \frac{1}{\sqrt{t}} \,dt$.
As a result, $\sum_{k=2}^{10000} < \sum_{k=2}^{10000} \int_{k-1}^{k} \frac{1}{\sqrt{t}} \,dt = \int_{1}^{10000} \frac{1}{\sqrt{t}} \,dt$.
Since $\int_{1}^{10000} \frac{1}{\sqrt{t}} \,dt = 2 (\sqrt{10000} - \sqrt{1}) = 198$, we have $\sum_{k=2}^{10000} \frac{1}{\sqrt{k}} < 198$.
formal_code:
(*
  Authors: Wenda Li
*)

theory algebra_sum1onsqrt2to1onsqrt10000lt198 
  imports Complex_Main "HOL-Computational_Algebra.Computational_Algebra"
begin

theorem algebra_sum1onsqrt2to1onsqrt10000lt198 :
  "(\<Sum> k \<in> {2::nat..<10001}. (1 / sqrt k)) < 198"
  sorry

end
